greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(A328316(n),A328316(1+n)).
comment: All terms are odd, because the parity of A328316 alternates.
a(10) is 208 decimal digits long, and can be found in the b-file.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10
program: A276086(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= (p^(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 14 2019
